diff_hunk:
@@ -1,3 +1,22 @@
+r"""
+The following constraints are implemented:
+
+- ``constraints.boolean``
+- ``constraints.dependent``
+- ``constraints.greater_than(lower_bound)``
+- ``constraints.integer_interval(lower_bound, upper_bound)``
+- ``constraints.interval(lower_bound, upper_bound)``
+- ``constraints.lower_cholesky``
+- ``constraints.lower_triangular``
+- ``constraints.lower_triangular``
+- ``constraints.nonnegative_integer``
+- ``constraints.positive``
+- ``constraints.positive_integer``
+- ``constraints.real``
+- ``constraints.simplex``
+- ``constraints.unit_interval``
+"""
body: The registry depends on `constraints` and `transforms`, and `transforms` depends on `constraints`. Therefore if we were to move the registry to an existing file, it would need to live at the bottom of `transforms.py`. But that file is already crowded and will only grow in the future. Therefore I opted for a new separate file.
body_html: The registry depends on constraints and transforms, and transforms depends on constraints. Therefore if we were to move the registry to an existing file, it would need to live at the bottom of transforms.py. But that file is already crowded and will only grow in the future. Therefore I opted for a new separate file.
body_text: The registry depends on constraints and transforms, and transforms depends on constraints. Therefore if we were to move the registry to an existing file, it would need to live at the bottom of transforms.py. But that file is already crowded and will only grow in the future. Therefore I opted for a new separate file.
